Data & Analytics - Expression of interest - Various levels and locations

Company Name KPMG Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 184 views

Job description

  • Consulting opportunity (Consultant / Senior Consultant / Manager)
  • Data Scientist / Engineer / Analyst – R / Python / MATLAB or Java / Node.js / NoSQL / HTML5 or SQL / Alteryx / Tableau / Qlik
  • Multiple positions available – Melbourne, Sydney and Canberra
  • Flexible working options available

KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex

challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our

people and our communities.
You will work in a rapidly growing part of KPMG’s Management Consulting Practice with projects that span multiple locations and industry sectors.

Our highly skilled Data & Analytics team helps our clients to use their data resources for creating value, enhancing competitiveness and driving business decisions. Within Data & Analytics

We provide unique services through delivering consulting projects, custom analytics work, proofs of concept, fantastic face to face and on-line trainings and accreditations for our brightest minds around data and advanced analytics.

Your new role

Our team is seeking data analytics specialists to support our ambitious growth strategy. Working in our team you'll be mixing with some of the brightest minds while working on significant commercial projects – solving real world problems at some of the nation's most respected companies, using some of the most exciting and interesting data you wouldn’t normally have access to.
You’ll be working collaboratively within a team environment and building strong client relationships.

Joining our team you’ll be working across projects that are applying data solutions to solve client problems by

  • Solving challenging problems with advanced Data Science and Machine Learning techniques – using statistical tools like R, MATLAB, Python, SAS and SPSS.
  • Building solutions using technologies like Java, Python, Node.js, NoSQL databases – leveraging Big Data platforms like Hadoop, Spark on Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure.
  • Developing innovative web and mobile applications using HTML5, CSS and JavaScript (D3, jQuery, Bootstrap and React).
  • Working with emerging and innovative digital solutions, including Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain process bots and natural language processing

    • You bring to the role

    We are open to candidates of all skill levels and experience.You will describe yourself as one of these analytics roles and bring relevant experience in your chosen area

  • Data Scientist Using Data Science techniques and Machine Learning skills over Big Data
  • Data Engineer Engineering modern data solutions or pipelines to facilitate advanced analytics, visualisation & interactive data applications
  • Data Analyst Analysing and business consulting with data – using relational databases (SQL), data workbench & visualisation tools for project delivery, applying business logic and interpreting results

    • You’ll demonstrate your experience in a consulting environment and/or experience within industry where you have developed your subject matter expertise and led others. You’ll need to bring an ability to work collaboratively within a team environment and to build strong client relationships. We're looking for talented people, team players and progressive thinkers who can communicate their ideas convincingly.

    You will
  • Have a questioning mind and lots of bright ideas
  • Be a critical thinker with strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Be comfortable with manipulating and combining large, high dimensional datasets from multiple sources
  • Have an ability to interpret findings and identify key insights to communicate to a non-technical audience
  • Have demonstrated experience building relationships with internal and/or external clients
  • Be passionate about delivering high quality work

    • What We Offer You

    We offer rewarding careers for outstanding professionals, ongoing learning and development opportunities, a collaborative and inclusive culture, and flexible and agile work practices that focus on our people's wellbeing to drive innovation and entrepreneurship. We also believe that our business plays a distinct and vital role in helping solve important social and environmental issues; and use our unique skills and expertise to help create positive and lasting impacts for our communities.

    We believe diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. We are consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and our inclusive culture promotes the development of our people irrespective of gender, ethnicity, generation, flexible work status, family circumstances, sexual orientation or disability.

    This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of KPMG and its ongoing success. So if you want a career where you can use your deep expertise to deliver real results, talk to us first.

    Industry

    • Accounting
    • Financial Services
    • Management Consulting

C# (.NET) Software Engineer ($30K/yr) - Online Hiring Event

Company Name Crossover for Work Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 26 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We're running an Online Hiring Event on September 1st, 2018 to hire C# (.NET) Software Engineers ($30K/yr)

Online Hiring Events are live forums designed to enable you to understand the role and requirements through an interactive Q&A session followed by a self-directed testing process. The testing takes between 3-5 hours to complete. It’s worth taking the time to finish all the tests because we evaluate every single complete application to find the top talent.

This event will include all testing required to apply for the role. Upon grading the tests, and if you advance, we will set up an interview with the hiring manager.

As a Software Engineer, you will be the part of a team responsible for ensuring that customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of our products. We want to give you the ability to look at the code in ways it has never been looked at before, to understand the interdependency in the code.

We are creating higher quality code by using the latest technologies and toolsets. We use data to make decisions, bringing big data and analysis to software development. We use cutting edge of software development and innovate improvements on the newest technologies. We want people who are adaptable and can learn new things, bringing new ideas and concepts to solve complex business problems.

We are on the cutting edge of software development, and we innovate improvements on the newest technologies. We want people who are adaptable and can learn new things, and can use new ideas and concepts to solve business problems.

EXPECTATIONS
  • Develop expertise in one or more of our proprietary enterprise software products.
  • Leverage your broad technology capabilities to inspire and develop real enterprise-class software.
Candidate Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Computer Engineering
2+ years of experience as a hands-on software engineer
A ruthless commitment to testing the code you’ve written

Proficiency In The Following Skills And Technologies Is Mandatory
  • Programming Language (Java / C++ / C#(.Net) / PHP / Python / Ruby on Rails)
  • Database(SQL Server/Oracle/MySQL/MongoDB/Cassandra)
  • SOA, EDA, and Design patterns
  • Javascript (ReactJS, AngularJS) , HTML5, CSS3
  • Cloud computing architecting
  • Linux, Django, REST, tools for CI/CD (Jenkins), Git, and shell scripting
  • DevOps
  • Writing Unit Test Cases
MVC and knowledge of another server-side programming language is desired but not mandatory
Demonstrate success as a problem solver, be result-oriented, and a self-starter
Comfortable “working virtually” with teammates and customers around the world - we do a lot of Skype and video conferencing
Good proficiency in the English language

Bootcamp Program

As a candidate for this position, you are invited to take part in a paid training program led by our best-in-class teams, on best-in-class technologies in our 4-week Bootcamp program.

After grading your tests, you will be eligible to take the Bootcamp which is usually held within a week of obtaining your test results. You will be paid the full-time rate for 40 hours per week for four weeks.

Once the Bootcamp tests are complete, we will be able to evaluate you for the position correctly. Taking the Bootcamp doesn’t guarantee that you will be hired, but you will learn everything you'll need to be successful in the role as part of the hiring process.

Crossover is redefining the way people work. A future where all high-skill jobs go to the cloud and big-data is used to help individuals and teams become more and more productive. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our workforce is global and will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent and are now in over 108 different countries. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing cloud talent. Our platform connects customers to the world’s best people for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we don’t just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.

Seniority Level

Internship

Industry

  • Computer Software
  • Internet
  • Information Technology and Services

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Information Technology
  • Engineering
  • Consulting

Commercial Business Analyst

Company Name Swinburne University of Technology Company Location John Street, Hawthorn , Melbourne, VIC 3122, AU

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 53 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

• Finance – Corporate Services

• Attractive salary negotiable based on relevant experience

• Full-time, ongoing role, Hawthorn location


About the job
Working as part of a small team of Commercial Business Analysts, you will partner with our Operations (including IT, People and Culture, Facilities) executive team, providing them with monthly analysis of their financial performance. In collaboration with the Operations executive team, you will prepare and monitor their annual operational plan, and update its expected full year performance on a regular basis. Through building close relationships with the business, you will be well-placed to create the narrative behind the numbers to derive actionable insights that can drive commercial thinking, consideration of long term impacts, and strategic developments. In preparing monthly variance reports, you will be able to call out any opportunities or risks to the executive team.

About Swinburne
Swinburne delivers excellence in teaching and research in science, technology, business, law, design and innovation. As a multi-sector provider, there are opportunities to apply for jobs in higher education, vocational education and pathways. Or you can work in professional services to support the delivery of quality education. Find jobs in marketing and communications, customer service, information technology, finance, human resources and administration.\xa0

About you
To be successful in the role, you will have:

• Significant experience in financial analysis and related activities, preferably in a large and complex organization

• Proven time management skills, including the ability to plan and organise conflicting workload priorities, adhere to deadlines and work effectively under pressure

• Demonstrated solid analytical and conceptual skills and the ability to translate financial data into meaningful insights for a non-financial audience

• Excellent communication skills

A full list of the selection criteria is available within the position description


Benefits

• Participate in regular staff and management development programs

• Hawthorn Aquatic and Leisure Centre (HALC) discounted memberships

• Weekly yoga and pilates classes

• Flexible working arrangements


Discover more discounts when you start at Swinburne. Receive movie tickets and staff membership options at the Swinburne bookshop. Theres news subscriptions and computer and software discounts on offer.

Further information, contacts and support
To start an application click on apply' at the bottom of this page and submit a resume. Please include a cover letter and resume only.

Please do not email or send paper applications, all applications must be submitted online.

For further information about the position, please contact Ania Gruba (Recruitment Consultant) on 03 9214 4856.

If you are experiencing technical difficulties with your application, please contact the Recruitment team on +61 3 9214 8600 (option 2).

Should you require further support for an interview due to special needs or consideration, please contact our Diversity Consultant, Dr. Walter Robles, on inclusion@swin.edu.au, or our Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Employment Officer, Sherrin Trautmann on deadlycareers@swin.edu.au.


Applications close at 5pm on 28th September 2018

Agencies please note: this vacancy is being managed directly by Swinburne’s Recruitment team. We will contact our preferred agency partners should we require additional support. Thank you.

Director

  • Higher Education
  • Nonprofit Organization Management

Full-time

This role will be responsible for developing and leading a new research program in the Institute for Healthcare Transformation, a new research institute at Deakin University.

Program Management Office (PMO) Lead

Company Name WorkSafe Victoria Company Location Geelong

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 203 views

Job description

At WorkSafe our passion for the wellbeing of Victorian workers brings us together. Our people come from a wide range of professions and with no two days ever being the same, diverse thinking comes naturally to us. As we build the WorkSafe of the future we’re committed to delivering industry best practice to our people, our customers and the community. We pride ourselves on being a great place to work and offer flexibility to facilitate work/life balance.

The WorkSafe 2030 Program (WSV2030) is significant in terms of its scale, complexity and expenditure. The PMO Lead is a key role within the Transformation Operations Business Unit and is integral to the successful delivery of the 2030 Transformation program.



About the role

Key responsibilities include:
  • Maintaining an enterprise view of in-scope projects for Horizons 1, 2 & 3 of the transformation
  • Developing a consolidated view of the Transformation Program for reporting through to the Chief of Transformation, Program Director and the Transformation Steering Committee
  • Ensuring PMO methodology and reporting, including scheduling, scope change management, risk reporting is understood and applied;
  • Providing enterprise strategy alignment to ensure that the projects are aligned to the objectives of the transformation;
  • Overseeing value/benefits tracking and management of projects and programs
  • Working collaborativley with vendors to ensure successfully delivery of deliverables and consolidated enterprise reporting
  • Create strategies for the effective planning, monitoring and delivery of the program of work.
  • Supporting and assisting with the planning and initiation of programs and projects and the implementation of the Governance and related program/project frameworks
  • Establishing and maintaining relationships with senior stakeholders and understanding of their needs.



Skills & Experience

 Previous experience in leading a PMO
  • Strong stakeholder management with public and private sector groups, Government and internal stakeholders.
  • Proven experience successfully managing portfolios, programs and projects.
  • Extensive experience in a leadership and/or advisory capacity at a senior level.
  • Demonstrated ability to influence and guide staff at all levels of seniority.
  • Strong leadership and people management skills including the ability to motivate and develop people.
  • Portfolio, Program and Project Management experience
  • Tertiary qualification / post graduate qualification (ideally in Project Management.)
  • Program and Project Assurance experience.




What’s in it for you?

In addition to the unique and exciting opportunity to play a key role in the delivery of WSV2030, we also offer a range of great benefits, including work variety, learning and development opportunities, and a leading health and wellbeing program.

Applications close midnight Monday 10th September, however candidates are strongly encouraged to submit their application as soon as possible. Click the link to apply, and join us in making a difference to Victorian lives. Confidential enquiries can be made to Roma Grant at 9641 1807.

WorkSafe are striving to build a diverse workforce that reflects the Victorian community we serve.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

  • Government Administration
  • Public Safety
  • Program Development

Full-time

  • Management
  • Strategy/Planning
  • Consulting

851100711:
[

Senior Educator 2 Domestic Projects

Company Name Chisholm Institute Company Location Dandenong, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 56 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Full time, Fixed term contract upto 2 years
  • Full time, Fixed term contract to 31 December 2020
  • Location: Dandenong


About Us

Chisholm is Victoria’s premier public vocational education and training provider, with campuses located across Melbourne and the south east.

Each year, we welcome some 30,000 students from over 43 culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. More than 1,200 passionate and dedicated Chisholm employees work together to deliver quality training and education in Melbourne’s south east manufacturing heartland and key residential growth corridor.

A Victorian Government-owned TAFE, we aim to lead the way in education and training to inspire success and transform lives.

Our purpose is to excel in education and training and be respected and valued for enhancing the social and economic futures of individuals, industry and communities.

Our drive for commercial success is underpinned by our core values of Opportunity, Integrity, Collaboration, and Achievement.

In the past 20 years, we have grown significantly to become a multi-sector institute, delivering a broad range of education and training programs and services in higher education, vocational education and training (VET) and school sectors across ten campuses in Victoria, online, in the workplace and overseas with partner educational and government organisations.

We offer nearly 500 courses, from VCE/VCAL/VETiS, through to nationally accredited qualifications such as certificates, diplomas, advanced diplomas, degrees, graduate certificates, graduate diplomas and short courses.

About The Role

This role is accountable for the provision of educational leadership to teaching staff through the focus and development of domestic project strategies and programs that promote the Institute’s Educational Excellence Framework.

This position directly supports the General Manager in the Engineering & Electrotechnology in managing a range of domestic educational projects and leading the implementation of educational excellence, business growth and opportunities that enhance the Institute’s reputation and meets industry and community needs in the course areas as designated.

The incumbent is a key member of the Senior Educator Network within the Institute and provides contemporary teaching leadership and expertise in their subject matter area and educational excellence.

Your Key Accountabilities Will Be To
  • Lead and participate within the Business Area to ensure ongoing growth, lead the process for product development and areas of specialisation, and promotion of commercial activity
  • Develop and participate in innovative delivery models and customised products to meet specific client needs and revenue growth targets
  • Provide leadership in program development to meet professional standards, training packages and ASQA requirements
  • Mentor and support teaching staff through change to ensure professional standards are maintained and Chisholm objectives are met
  • Contribute and drive the development, delivery and resourcing of new courses and delivery models to support a variety of qualifications, outcomes and increased student engagement.
  • Manage strategies to support learners including mentoring and work preparation programs, study skills support, alternative delivery and assessment methodologies, cultural differences and communication requirements
  • Develop relationships and liaise with key stakeholders such as employers, schools and other education providers to explore pathway options for learners
  • Lead and develop strategies to meet Institute performance indicators, quality, relevant standards, registration requirements and audit requirements.
  • Coach and mentor colleagues, particularly early career teachers, to facilitate the achievement of shared Chisholm goals


About You

You will have relevant tertiary qualifications in:
  • Certificate IV in Training and Assessment (TAE40116)
  • Vocational qualifications at AQF level 6 or higher
  • Vocational qualifications relevant to or above the level required and industry currency.
  • Diploma or Advanced Diploma in a related discipline
  • Diploma VET (TAE50111).

Project management experience would be highly desirable.

Crucial to your success will a strong understanding of contemporary approaches to education, teaching and leadership.

A proven track record in design and delivery of up to-date and engaging programs in conjunction with demonstrated leadership and coordination of complex business development activity such as the preparation of submissions and tenders will see you succeed in this position.

You will have the ability to quickly develop rapport with students and colleagues from a diverse background in a collaborative and innovative environment. As well as have a firm understanding of educational administration tools and practices.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

At Chisholm, we embrace differences in gender, age, ethnicity, race, cultural background, disability, religion and sexual orientation. We know that diversity and inclusion helps us to attract, recruit, engage and retain a team of talented people. If you require specific support to apply for this position, please advise the recruiting manager whose contact details are listed in the advertisement. We will work with you to identify the best way to assist you.

How To Apply

Applications for this position close 9am Monday 1 October 2018

Applications Should Include
  • a covering letter
  • curriculum vitae
  • contact details of three (3) referees

Appointment to this position is subject to satisfactory completion of Safety Screening requirements including but not limited to:
  • valid Employee Working With Children Check
  • verification of unrestricted work rights in Australia, eg citizenship, passport or birth certificate
  • certified copies of qualifications

If you have any questions regarding the position or require further information please contact Grant Collis, Manager – Electrical on +61 03 9212 5137.

Chisholm Institute reserves the right to withdraw an advertised position at any stage.

Industry

  • Nonprofit Organization Management
  • Higher Education
  • Education Management

Employment Type

Contract

Job Functions

  • Education
  • Training

The opportunity

We have a wonderful opportunity for an Associate Superannuation Adviser to join our Member Engagement team based in Melbourne.


You will be responsible for providing general and personal phone advice to members on HESTA’s products and services. This will include promoting the personal advice service and greater financial literacy amongst members of the Fund by assisting members to understand the elements of their Fund, identifying their advice needs and ensuring members receive personal advice from HESTA in line with their needs.


You’ll need to hit the ground running with this role, have exceptional communication skills and be able to quickly build relationships at all levels, coupled with a passion for what you do.


We’re looking for someone who’s experienced providing general and personal advice in an outbound role working within the superannuation or financial services industry. You will have excellent communication and interpersonal skills and enjoy providing advice to your clients over the phone. It is essential you have an Advanced Diploma in Financial Services.

\xa0

  • Access to great benefits, including a market competitive remuneration package
  • Be part of an ambitious team, and an innovative and inclusive culture
  • Opportunities to develop and grow your career
